intro: Oldenlandia scopulorum var. lanceolata, commonly known as the rock oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky environments. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is typically found growing on rocky outcrops and in dry, well-drained soils. It has adapted to harsh conditions with a deep root system and waxy leaf surfaces to reduce water loss. This variety is part of the Rubiaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental species.
